Kevin McCallister.Action: Records and plays back his own voice using a Walkman, quietly responding to his mother.
Uses a recording Walkman to manage and confirm his packing details by recording and playing back instructions to himself.
Does not appear to be involved actively in the family’s pre-travel chaos and instead focuses on organizing his own belongings.
Rolls his eyes at Kate's gift and ignores her enthusiasm about the inflatable clown toy.
Speaks honestly to Kate and Peter about his feelings on Christmas in Florida and his thoughts on growing up, showing candidness.
Rewinds and plays back his own voice on the Walkman to check something carefully.
Dismisses Grandma Ellie's gift (inflatable clown) with disinterest and eye-rolling, showing lack of appreciation or social tact.
Answers questions about being packed and health straightforwardly, indicating readiness and honesty.
Complains about not being able to wear his tie because Uncle Frank is showering, showing avoidance rather than problem-solving.
Sneaks into the bathroom quietly to catch Uncle Frank singing off-key, shows curiosity and stealth.
Uses a tape recorder to prank the girls, demonstrates creativity and playful intelligence.
Runs quickly to slam the door and turn off recorder when caught, shows awareness and quick reaction.
Makes sarcastic and teasing remarks to others, indicating social awareness but potentially alienating others.
Asks Buzz for help tying his tie, showing willingness to seek assistance and be open.
Calls Buzz by a respectful name ('Mr. Buzz') and tries to engage amicably.
Fails to get help from peers and looks nervous, indicating vulnerability but no hostility.
Sings a Christmas solo with great gusto despite nervousness and some audience tittering
Scowls at teasing about his attire, showing discomfort
Appears unaware of being teased with candles behind his ears, maintaining focus on performance
Sings with great gusto during his solo despite the disruptive prank by Buzz lighting his ears with candles.
Appears nervous before the solo but proceeds to perform anyway.
Unaware that his ears are glowing from the candlelight held by Buzz, leading to some audience tittering.
Punches Buzz in the stomach after being laughed at on stage.
Shows scowl, sour and angry demeanor after the incident.
Allows Buzz to apologize sincerely and listen to his remorse.
Refuses to apologize for his actions, expresses resentment toward family and brother, lashes out verbally.
Holds his temper and speaks honestly about his feelings despite family pressure.
Expresses defiance and dissatisfaction openly, showing emotional confidence but poor social tact.
Decides to walk out of the family room in anger despite warnings about consequences.
Refuses to apologize to Buzz despite Kate’s urging, insists on holding grudges.
Acknowledges family tensions but expresses desire to be alone and have fun on his own.
Eventually turns off his Walkman after a tense exchange, shows some willingness to listen.
Insists on carrying his own ticket to avoid being ditched by others.
Swipes batteries from Kate's bag despite her telling him not to.
Responds sharply to Buzz's insult with 'Why don't you shut up?'
Carries his own ticket to avoid being ditched, showing foresight and responsibility.
Sneaks a look in Kate's bag and notices the cash-filled envelope, indicating curiosity and awareness.
Attempts to find batteries in Kate's bag when asked, but isn't immediately successful as Kate refuses.
Focuses on changing Walkman batteries, keeps pace with family but ends up following a stranger's trench coat down the wrong concourse.
Manages to open and close battery compartment, turns on Walkman successfully.
Politely explains to the ticket agent why he is traveling alone and cooperates fully.
Rushes to board the plane without causing trouble or demanding special treatment.
Successfully presents his ticket and boards the plane alone without assistance, confidently explaining his situation to the agent.
Rushes to catch the flight but shows no hesitation or confusion at the gate.
Engages in a sincere conversation with the college girl, showing interest and empathy about her difficult experience.
Engages in conversation with the college girl, listens carefully and asks relevant questions.
Does not show immediate understanding of the college girl's situation (initial confusion about flying alone).
Remains calm and composed while discussing serious topics such as being lost and emergency landings.
Thinks about the College Girl's advice and tries to reassure himself by saying Florida is safe even though he hasn't been there.
Searches the airport exhaustively for his family, even checking under bathroom stalls and asking strangers.
Listens to advice about staying safe and being careful in New York but seems confused and fails to fully understand the implication of the warning.
Thinks he's going to Florida and confidently states it is not dangerous, despite not having been there, showing some naivety.
After flight disembarks, Kevin looks for his family carefully, paying attention to the last people to exit, showing observational skills and situational awareness.
Wanders around LA Guardia searching for family including checking under bathroom stalls and knocking, which is a practical albeit somewhat awkward approach to find someone.
Politely tries to get attention from the ticket agent despite being ignored initially.
Makes casual, somewhat humorous observations about the weather mismatch and people’s clothing.
Persistently returns to the ticket counter and explains the situation is an emergency despite the agent's irritation.
Notices inconsistency in weather and environment; questions the ticket agent about the city seen outside the airport window despite being told to wait.
Shows patience by initially waiting at the ticket counter and tries to get help despite the agent being irritated.
Exhibits confusion and puzzlement about the situation and his surroundings, indicating uncertainty in understanding his environment.
Expresses confusion about the location of Florida, scratching his head and appearing shocked.
Realizes he is in New York while his family is in Florida and begins to smile confidently despite the mix-up.
Hands on hips, looks up confidently at Empire State Building with a big grin.
Is separated and lost among adults searching and passing his bag around, indicating adults' lack of awareness of his competence at the moment, but not Kevin's own failure.
Successfully navigates New York City landmarks and recognizes the Kensington Towers Hotel from a photo on a game show.
Uses the pay telescope to take snapshots of the city, showing awareness and curiosity in a new environment.
Responds with alarm upon seeing the elderly woman covered in pigeons, indicating alertness to unusual situations.

Runs out of the park cautiously, looks back to check if the Pigeon Lady is following him, waits for the walk light before crossing the street, navigates through heavy traffic by weaving through pedestrian traffic safely, and successfully evades Harry and Marv by briefly brushing past one of them unnoticed.
Smiles at the woman and makes a light, friendly comment about toilets for kids vs. phone booths.
Uses a deep voice to impersonate his father on the phone, being deceptive.
Explains honestly to the hotel clerk why he cannot make a reservation himself and presents his father's credit card, showing sincerity and straightforwardness.
Uses a deep voice to impersonate his father during the phone call, demonstrating cleverness but a slight lack of straightforwardness or trustworthiness.
Successfully deceives the hotel operator and clerk by impersonating his father to secure a hotel reservation despite being a child, using quick thinking and confidence.
Explains convincingly why he, a kid, cannot make the reservation himself, showing awareness and cleverness.
Uses an American Express card to support his story and gain trust at the hotel.
Keeps credit cards from his mother but likely doesn't know how to use them, indicating innocence and lack of intent to misuse.
His parents remark humorously and embarrassingly about past incidents of Kevin being left alone, showing family awareness rather than Kevin's direct behavior.
Interacts politely with the hotel clerk ('Enjoy your stay with us') and seems impressed but not arrogant when successfully using the credit card.
Successfully uses his father's credit card to check into a hotel by himself.
Forgets that he has the wallet and credit cards with him, causing concern for his parents.
Politely thanks the clerk, saying 'My pleasure. You've been most helpful.'
Shows some hesitation and embarrassment when realizing the bellman expects a tip.
Gives gum to another person and says 'And there's plenty more where that came from.'
Greets pool guests with a friendly smile and politely asks if doing a cannonball would bother anyone.
Politely asks businessmen to stop using foul language because of a promise to his grandmother.
Responds calmly to apology for foul language and engages with businessmen in a sincere way.
Asks businessmen if they are naked, causing them to leave – a somewhat intrusive but also innocent and straightforward action.
Takes out the family photo and studies it contemplatively.
Considers visiting Uncle Rob for presents.
Jumps on the bed excitedly, enjoying vacation.
Lies calmly in bed and looks through Kate's bag to find useful information, such as the address book.
Considers visiting his Uncle Rob in New York to potentially get gifts, showing some forward thinking.
Takes a family photo from Kate's wallet, perhaps indicating curiosity or reflection.
Feels terribly lonely looking at a picture, lies back on the bed quietly without causing trouble.
Quickly turns off the lights and hides in the bathroom when someone knocks on the hotel room door, showing awareness and quick thinking.
Feels terribly lonely and looks toward the phone but does not take further action like calling for help.
Sets effective traps and outsmarts the Concierge, causing him to injure himself and flee.
Waves and exchanges polite words with the Concierge, indicates social friendliness.
Dismisses the Concierge's offer of apology with a bit of sarcasm about privacy invasion.
Shows awareness of his situation being alone and unfamiliar in New York but plans to make the best of it.
Interacts confidently and casually with the Concierge, using humor and sarcasm.
Demonstrates self-care by being clean and well-dressed, preparing himself properly.
Presses sunroof button and playfully throws pepperoni slices out for a dog to eat.
Uses father's stolen credit card to check into hotel anonymously.
Tells the driver to be careful with the package and not let anyone look in it, whispers that it contains underpants.
Smiles with a huge grin standing outside the toy store, speaks to himself cheerfully.

Responds politely and kindly to the Woman, compliments the store sincerely, acknowledges and appreciates Mr. Duncan's charitable actions.
Discreetly hides the amount of money he is carrying from the Woman.
Discreetly manages money in front of the store clerk, handling multiple twenty-dollar bills without showing all his cash, and interacts confidently and politely with the woman.
Uses humor and social skills to engage the store clerk (e.g., joking about being afraid of his own shadow and claiming to have many grandmothers).
Offers money he earned shoveling snow to help the hospital instead of spending it on candy or toys for himself.
Wishes the woman a Merry Christmas and shows concern by telling her to bundle up in the cold.
Runs away from Harry and Marv when they spot him, avoiding confrontation.
Buys half a dozen necklaces from a street vendor while escaping.
Navigates through heavy traffic and narrowly escapes pursuers by taking quick and risky actions such as scrambling under a delivery truck and weaving through vehicles.
Buys half a dozen necklaces impulsively during a chase, possibly using resources to create a distraction or escape aid.
Stops and assesses traffic lights carefully despite being chased, indicating situational awareness and caution.
Looks fearful when facing difficult traffic crossing, showing some hesitation or fear in a dangerous situation.
Runs into the street to confront or evade the villains, shows quick thinking and bravery.
Rips necklaces apart, scattering beads on the ground potentially as a trap for Harry and Marv.
Runs toward a hotel doorman to get help against the pursuing villains.
Breathless and pointing out the danger to the concierge, demonstrating honesty and trustworthiness.
Runs into the street at green light and uses necklaces as a distraction to trip the villains.
Quickly signals hotel staff for help after spotting the pursuers.
His breathlessness and hesitation when confronted by the concierge, showing some anxiety but still attempting to communicate.
Breaks loose from the Concierge’s grab and runs away to avoid capture.

Slides skillfully between the Saleswoman's legs on the slick marble floor to evade capture.
Leaps into a waiting elevator and presses the button for his floor quickly.

Pauses and hesitates at the elevator, debating whether to use it, showing momentary uncertainty.
Uses a rubber fist toy as a weapon to fend off the Concierge and escape hotel employees chasing him.
Grabs a handful of cookies from the kitchen and runs off, showing opportunistic behavior without regard for others' property.
Steals cookies quickly and escapes chaotic kitchen, showing agility and quick thinking.
Appears terrified and struggles to control his fall when leaping off loading dock, showing vulnerability in physical control.

Considers making a move upon seeing a police officer, indicating awareness and tactical thinking.
Pinches a woman's bottom without consent.
Punches Harry in the belly after causing trouble.
Pinches the woman's rump, showing impulsive and disrespectful behavior.
Distracts his captors by attacking one and then escapes with their travel bag, demonstrating quick thinking and resourcefulness.
Vaults the park wall and races into the underbrush, showing agility and confident movement to evade capture.

Moves carefully around a sleeping man on the sidewalk, showing caution and respect.
Hurries through a frightening and hostile environment, primarily focused on his own safety without engaging others.

Navigates Central Park West in a frightening and unfamiliar environment, moves carefully around a sleeping man without confrontation, adjusts his route to avoid danger, and stays alert to surroundings.
Appears frightened and stumbles into a man, causing alarm and drawing attention.

Is terrified and breathing heavily, indicating fear impacting confidence.

Explains calmly why people get scared of things unfamiliar to them and relates it to his own experiences, showing self-awareness and reasoning.
Recognizes he may be bothering the Pigeon Lady and politely offers to leave, showing social awareness and emotional intelligence.
Acts confidently and patiently when interacting with the Pigeon Lady, waiting for her response without rushing or frustration.
Appears respectful and perceptive in reading the Pigeon Lady’s nonverbal cues, adjusting his behavior accordingly.
No notable negative actions or omissions related to competence observed in the excerpt.
Shows empathy towards the Pigeon Lady by relating her feelings of being ignored to his experience as the youngest child in his family.
Engages in a sincere and open conversation about feelings and fears with the Pigeon Lady.
Offers constructive perspective on the Pigeon Lady's fear of love by sharing a personal story about his roller blades.
Shows emotional insight by comparing himself to the pigeons and recognizing feelings of neglect within his family.

Considers the Pigeon Lady's advice about doing good deeds for others and offers his hand to her before leaving.

Considers the Pigeon Lady’s advice thoughtfully before taking action to do a good deed.
Offers his hand to the Pigeon Lady and says goodbye respectfully, showing social confidence and emotional intelligence.
Runs quickly through the city and navigates to his destination using unconventional methods (climbing up a rubbish tube).
His departure from the hotel is facilitated by running away from hotel staff after they discover the stolen card.

Takes tools and prepares traps and barriers in the brownstone, such as pouring sap on the floor, setting varnish cans on the scaffold, filling the toilet bowl with paint thinner, removing a doorknob, greasing the fire escape stairs.
Climbs up the rubbish tube using ribs for grip and footing.
Selects and assembles a variety of tools from a tool chest (wood saw, hack saw, hammer, rope, electric drill, screwdriver, butane torch).

Pours Monster Sap on basement floor to create a trap.
Loads a plumber's bag with wrenches.

Carries multiple cans of varnish outside to set up traps.
Drops rope through hole in floor to prepare for rope access.
Greases fire escape stairs with mechanical lubricant to create a slippery trap.
Squirts soap onto the sidewalk outside the toy store to thwart robbers.
Prepares a paving stone wrapped in an envelope addressed to the store owner, presumably as a warning or message.
Bangs on the store window and waves to the robbers, then takes a picture of them in the act.
Carefully prepares a paving stone weighted message and uses a camera flash to alert the robbers, demonstrating planning and boldness.
Drops into the alley and quickly moves away, showing awareness and caution.
Throws a paving stone through the store window, setting off the burglar alarm to stop the burglars.
Leads Harry and Marv on a chase through the streets, taunting them by yelling and taking photos.
Throws a brick at Marv to stop the criminals from advancing.
Feigns compliance by agreeing to give up his camera but instead skillfully throws a brick to hit Marv unexpectedly.
Silently assesses the situation from a vantage point on the roof without reacting immediately to threats.
Sets up a booby trap using a dart pistol rigged with a string to protect himself from intruders.
Demonstrates awareness of his environment and anticipates burglars' actions by preparing defensive measures.

Sets up the booby traps (e.g., greased fire escape, nail on door with plumber’s bag trap, slippery sap on floor, rope tied to shelving unit with paint cans) that effectively thwart the burglars' attempted entry into the house, showing strategic planning and mechanical skill.
Mocks the burglars by saying 'a kid always wins against two idiots'

Sets traps like dropping paint cans and swinging iron pipe at Harry and Marv.

Drops paint cans to thwart Harry and Marv's ascent, showing tactical planning and skill.

Sets up multiple traps to stop the burglars Harry and Marv from invading his home.
Mocks and taunts the burglars while they are hurt and climbing stairs.
Cuts the sewage pipe rope to make traps fall on the intruders, demonstrating quick thinking and technical skill.
Threads a rope through the doorknob hole and creates a loop to set a trap, showing resourcefulness and planning.
Pushes a heavy metal tool case to the edge of the stairs and secures it with a rope to prepare a trap, indicating strategic use of his environment.
Shouts that he is scared despite carefully setting traps, which could reveal emotional vulnerability but does not detract from his effective actions.
Yells 'I'm down here, you morons!' to Harry and Marv after escaping from them.
Waves to Harry and Marv after escaping, showing a playful but mocking gesture.
Secures a rope to a heavy object, safely lowers himself from the roof using gloves and careful technique.
Uses a strategically prepared escape route while taunting his pursuers from a safe position.
Waves to Harry and Marv from below, showing boldness but a playful taunt.
Grins devilishly while setting a match to a rope soaked in kerosene to stop Harry and Marv climbing down, endangering them.
Says 'Merry Christmas' sarcastically while committing a dangerous prank on his adversaries.
Calls 911 to report the criminals, providing accurate location and warning of a gun.
Jumps down off a scaffold to escape danger quickly and efficiently.
Immediately uses a pay phone to call 911 and reports the criminals with clear and accurate information despite being scared and breathless.
Maintains focus on important tasks despite distractions (forgets the pigeons and concentrates on the emergency call).
Runs to escape Harry and Marv despite being hurt and losing his belongings.
Runs across a busy avenue to escape pursuers but loses footing on ice and falls, dropping his bag which contains important items.

Looks back to assess his pursuers' positions, showing situational awareness during a chase.

Is terrified and in pain when threatened by Harry and Marv, but does not retaliate aggressively.

Leaps a rock outcropping and scampers away while scooping up the travel bag on the ground as he runs past.

Expresses regret for mean things said to his family and wishes to see his mother to apologize, expresses love even for Buzz.
Feels lonely and sad, demonstrating vulnerability and sincere desire for family connection.
Runs into his mother's arms and embraces her tightly after reuniting.
Acknowledges and responds warmly to his parents' concern and presence.
Waves to Harry (one of the antagonists) as he passes by.
Carefully removes and examines the monogrammed bell, recognizing it as the family bell, demonstrating attention to detail and understanding of its significance.
Is bewildered and dumbstruck upon seeing his mother, showing a momentary lapse in confident grasp of his situation.
